description: This dashboard can help troubleshooting issue in k8s cluster at cluster, node and namespace level.

panels.description:
This panel shows node memory usage:

node_memory_MemTotal - node_memory_MemAvailable

targets.expr:
((node_memory_MemTotal{cluster="$cluster"}  + on(instance) group_left(nodename) 
node_uname_info{cluster="$cluster"}) - (node_memory_MemAvailable{cluster="$cluster"}  + on(instance) group_left(nodename) 
node_uname_info{cluster="$cluster"}))

panels.title: Memory usage in $cluster cluster by node
Memory usage by namespace in $cluster cluster

panels.description: This panel shows node CPU utilisation
panels.title: Overall CPU usage in $cluster cluster

panels.description: This panel shows node CPU utilisation
panels.title: Node CPU usage[5m] in $cluster cluster

panels.description: This panel shows the NotReady state of nodes. If any node goes in NotReady state, graph value will go from 1 to 0.
panels.title: Node $node Ready state
container count by pod on node $node

panels.description:
The PLEG health check  calls docker ps to detect container states changes, and call docker ps and inspect to get the details of those containers.
After finishing each iteration, it updates a timestamp. If the timestamp hasn't been updated for a while (i.e., 3 minutes), the health check fails.

Unless your node is loaded with huge number of pods that PLEG can't finish doing all these in 3 minutes (which should not happen), the most probable cause would be that docker is slow.
panels.title: kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket

panels.description: container_memory_usage_bytes  includes memory usage in bytes,   including all memory regardless of when it was accessed.. The better metric is container_memory_working_set_bytes as this is what the OOM killer is watching for.
panels.title: memory usage by container $container in $namespace namespace

panels.description: This panel shows no. of pod restarts in a namespace. Please choose container name from top of dashboard to check for the nodes where the pod with same container has jumped.
panels.title: Pod  $container node relation

title: Debug K8s my dguyhasnoname
